robotkaposzta_desktop.name: Desktop
robotkaposzta_desktop.description: Access features desktop computer features, like window functions, menus, tray icons, command line.

instance-prevent.name: Instance prevent
instance-prevent.desc: Whether prevent the user to open other instances.

url-load.name: URL load
url-load.desc: Load a project from a website. Caution: the website can run any desktop features.

export-start.name: Electron export
export-start.desc: Download a configuration for electron framework.

exec-command.display-text: Execute [i]{1}[/i] command (tag: [i]{0}[/i], arguments: [i]{2}[/i], hide: [i]{3}[/i], timeout: [i]{4}[/i], detached: [i]{5}[/i], directory: [i]{6}[/i], enviroment: [i]{7}[/i], zero argument: [i]{8}[/i], shell: [i]{9}[/i], killsignal: [i]{10}[/i])
exec-command.description: Execute a command in the operting system.

tag.name: Tag
tag.desc: The execute process' tag to identify it later.

command.name: Command
command.desc: The execute process' tag to identify it later.

windows-hide.name: Hide window
windows-hide.desc: Whether hide or show the execution window

timeout.name: Timeout
timeout.desc: The execution timeout. Use negative for unlimited time.

detached.name: Detached
detached.desc: Whether Detached the process from the project window. Will not close after the project closes.

cwd.name: Directory
cwd.desc: The working directory where execute the code.

env.name: Enviroment
env.desc: The environment key-value pairs in json format.

argv0.name: Zero argument
argv0.desc: Explicitly set the value of argv[0] sent to the child process. This will be set to command if not specified..

shell.name: Shell
shell.desc: A different shell can be specified.

kill-signal.name: Kill signal
kill-signal.desc: The signal value to be used when the spawned process will be killed by timeout or abort signal.

exec-message.description: Send message to the running command process.

tag.name: Tag
tag.desc: The execute process' tag to send message.

tag.name: Tag
tag.desc: The execute process' tag to stop.

open-context-menu.description: Open a context menu at a position.

path.name: Path
path.desc: The path of the menu item to load the context menu.

position-x.name: X
position-x.desc: The X position of the context menu.

position-y.name: Y
position-y.desc: The Y position of the context menu.

path.name: Path
path.desc: The path of the menu item to load the window menu.

path.name: Path
path.desc: The path of the menu element.

path.name: Path
path.desc: The path of the menu element.

path.name: Path
path.desc: The path of the menu element.

set-menu-item.display-text: Create [b]{0}[/b] menu item (index: [i]{1}[/i], type: [i]{2}[/i], text: [i]{3}[/i], subtext: [i]{4}[/i], icon: [i]{5}[/i], enable: [i]{6}[/i], checked: [i]{7}[/i], accelator: [i]{8}[/i], tooltip: [i]{9}[/i])
set-menu-item.description: Create a menu item in the memory. It can be used for Context, Window, Tray, Dock and Thumbar menu.

path.name: Path
path.desc: The path of the created menu.

index.name: Index
index.desc: The index of the place where insert the element. Note: use negative value for backward indexing e.g. -1 last element, -2 before last element.

subtext.name: Subtext
subtext.desc: Subtext of the menu item. Supports: [b]Electron[/b]

enable.name: Enable
enable.desc: Whether enable or disable the menu item.

checked.name: Checked
checked.desc: Whether checked or unchecked the checkbox menu item.

set-menu-item-type.description: Set an exist menu item's type.

path.name: Path
path.desc: The path of the created menu.

set-menu-item-index.description: Set an exist menu item's position.

path.name: Path
path.desc: The path of the created menu.

index.name: Index
index.desc: The index of the place where insert the element. Note: use negative value for backward indexing e.g. -1 last element, -2 before last element.

set-menu-item-text.description: Set an exist menu item's text.

path.name: Path
path.desc: The path of the created menu.

set-menu-item-subtext.description: Set an exist menu item's text.

path.name: Path
path.desc: The path of the created menu.

subtext.name: Subtext
subtext.desc: Subtext of the menu item. Supports: [b]Electron[/b]

set-menu-item-icon.description: Set an exist menu item's icon.

path.name: Path
path.desc: The path of the created menu.

set-menu-item-enabled.description: Set an exist menu item to enabled or disabled.

path.name: Path
path.desc: The path of the created menu.

mode.name: Mode
mode.desc: Whether enable or disable the menu item.

set-menu-item-checked.description: Set an exist checkbox or radion to checked. Note: it cannot overwrite radio behavior.

path.name: Path
path.desc: The path of the created menu.

state.name: State
state.desc: Whether checked or unchecked the checkbox menu item.

path.name: Path
path.desc: The path of the created menu.

path.name: Path
path.desc: The path of the created menu.

copy-menu-item.description: Copy a menu item path to other menu item.

origin-path.name: Origin path
origin-path.desc: Menu item which want to copy.

dest-path.name: Destination path
dest-path.desc: The destination path where want to copy the menu item.

mode.name: Mode
mode.desc: Choose which way to copy the menu. Reference: if you modify the original menu item the path will point to the new one.

remove-menu-item.description: Remove a menu item from the memory. It refresh the Popup, Window and Tray menu.

path.name: Path
path.desc: The path of the menu element.

unmaximize.description: Unmaximize the window (i.e. the reverse of maximizing).

restore.description: Restore the window (i.e. show again after minimizing).

set-size.description: Set the width and heigth of the window.

width.name: Width
width.desc: The new width of the window.

height.name: Height
height.desc: The new height of the window.

set-position.description: Set the position of the window on the screen.

x.name: X
x.desc: The X co-ordinate to move the window to on the screen.

y.name: Y
y.desc: The Y co-ordinate to move the window to on the screen.

animate.name: Animate
animate.desc: Whether set position will be animated.

set-max-size.description: Set the maximum size of the window on the screen.

width.name: Width
width.desc: The new maximum width of the window. Note: Use negative to unlimited.

height.name: Height
height.desc: The new maximum height of the window. Note: Use negative to unlimited.

set-min-size.description: Set the minimum size of the window on the screen.

width.name: Width
width.desc: The new minimum width of the window. Note: Use negative to unlimited.

height.name: Height
height.desc: The new minimum height of the window. Note: Use negative to unlimited.

set-opacity.description: Set the minimum size of the window on the screen. Supports: [b]Electron[/b] and [b]macOS[/b]/[b]Windows[/b].

opacity.name: Opacity
opacity.desc: The new opacity of the window.

set-visible.description: Set whether the window hidden or shown.

visibility.name: Visibility
visibility.desc: Choose whether the window is hidden or shown.

move-top.description: Moves window to top(z-order) regardless of focus. Supports: [b]Electron[/b]

request-attention.description: Start or stop requesting attention from the use, e.g. by flashing the title bar (depends on OS).

mode.name: Mode
mode.desc: Whether to request attention or stop a previous request for attention.

progress.name: Progress
progress.desc: The new progress of the window

type.name: Type
type.desc: The type of the progress. Supports: [b]Electron[/b] and [b]Windows[/b].

show-dev-tool.description: Display the web developer tools e.g. for Javascript debugging or inspecting console messages.

mode.name: Mode
mode.desc: The mode of the developer tools window.

open-window.description: Execute a command in the operting system.

message.name: Message
message.desc: The start message that send to the window.

show-frame.name: Show frame
show-frame.desc: Show the window frame or not.

send-window-message.display-text: Send message to window [i]{0}[/i] tag [i]{1}[/i] message [i]{2}[/i]

id.name: ID
id.desc: The ID of the window to send.

message.name: Message
message.desc: The message that send to the instance.

id.name: id
id.desc: The ID of the instance to close.

set-window-frame.description: Set whether the frame hidden or shown in around window. Caution: this action [b]restart[/b] the project. Supports: [b]Electron[/b].

visibility.name: Visibility
visibility.desc: Choose whether the frame around window is hidden or shown.

message.name: Message
message.desc: A message that send to the restarted window.

set-taskbar.description: Set whether the window tab hidden or shown in taskbar.

visibility.name: Visibility
visibility.desc: Choose whether the window in taskbar is hidden or shown.

state.name: State
state.desc: Choose whether to enable or disable the kiosk mode.

set-always-on-top.display-text: Set always on top to [i]{0}[/i] (level: [i]{1}[/i], relative level: [i]{2}[/i])
set-always-on-top.description: Enable or disable the window always being on top other windows.

state.name: State
state.desc: Choose whether to enable or disable the always on top mode.

level.name: Level
level.desc: Choose the level of the window. Supports: [b]Electron[/b], [b]macOS[/b]/[b]Windows[/b].

relative-level.name: Level
relative-level.desc: The number of layers higher to set this window relative to the given level. Supports: [b]Electron[/b], [b]macOS[/b].

set-visible-on-all-workspaces.description: Enable or disable the window always being on top other windows. Supports: [b]macOS[/b]/[b]Linux[/b]

visibility.name: Visibility
visibility.desc: Choose whether to enable or disable the always on top mode.

visible-on-fullscreen.name: Visible on fullscreen
visible-on-fullscreen.desc: Sets whether the window should be visible above fullscreen windows. Supports: [b]Elecrton[/b], [b]macOS[/b]/[b]Linux[/b].

set-protection.description: Enable or disable the window protection (disable screen recording). Supports: [b]Electron[/b], [b]macOS[/b]/[b]Windows[/b].

state.name: State
state.desc: Choose whether to enable or disable the always on top mode.

set-enabled.description: Enable or disable the window. Only in [b]Electron[/b].

state.name: State
state.desc: Choose whether to enable or disable the window.

set-closable.description: Enable or disable the window close button. Supports: [b]Electron[/b], [b]macOS[/b]/[b]Windows[/b].

state.name: State
state.desc: Choose whether to enable or disable the window.

set-resizable.description: Enable or disable the window resize function. Supports: [b]Electron[/b].

state.name: State
state.desc: Choose whether to enable or disable the window.

set-movable.description: Enable or disable the window move function. Supports: [b]Electron[/b], [b]macOS[/b]/[b]Windows[/b].

state.name: State
state.desc: Choose whether to enable or disable the window.

set-maximizable.description: Enable or disable the window maximize function. Supports: [b]Electron[/b], [b]macOS[/b]/[b]Windows[/b].

state.name: State
state.desc: Choose whether to enable or disable the window.

set-minimizable.description: Enable or disable the window minimize function. Supports: [b]Electron[/b], [b]macOS[/b]/[b]Windows[/b].

state.name: State
state.desc: Choose whether to enable or disable the window.

set-fullscreenable.description: Enable or disable the window fullscreen function. Supports: [b]Electron[/b].

state.name: State
state.desc: Choose whether to enable or disable the window.

set-close-prevent.description: Enable or disable the window close.

prevent.name: Prevent
prevent.desc: Choose whether to enable or disable the window prevention.

set-instance-prevent.description: Set whether allow the operating system to open a new instance of the exported program (instance can open other windows). Supports: [b]Electron[/b]

prevent.name: Prevent
prevent.desc: Choose whether to enable or disable the instance open prevention.

on-exec-message.description: Triggers when a command send a message.

on-exec-error.description: Triggers when a command send an error message.

on-exec-stop.description: Triggers when a command end running and stops.

is-menu-item-exist.description: True if menu item exist on path.

path.name: Path
path.desc: The path to compare.

is-menu-item-type.description: True if menu item exist with selected type.

path.name: Path
path.desc: The path to compare.

is-menu-item-enabled.description: True if menu item exist and enabled.

path.name: Path
path.desc: The path to compare.

is-menu-item-checked.description: True if menu item exist and checked.

path.name: Path
path.desc: The path to compare.

is-menu-item-visible.description: True if menu item exist and visible.

path.name: Path
path.desc: The path to compare.

on-any-menu-item-clicked.description: Triggers when any menu item is clicked.

on-menu-item-clicked.description: Triggers when secific menu item is clicked.

path.name: Path
path.desc: The path to compare.

on-screen-added.description: Triggers when screen added to the computer.

on-screen-changed.description: Triggers when change a settings of one of the screens.

on-screen-removed.description: Triggers when screen removed from the computer.

id.name: ID
id.desc: ID of the screen to test.

is-screen-touch-support.description: True if screen has a selected touch support.

id.name: ID
id.desc: ID of the screen to test.

is-screen-accelometer.description: True if screen accelometer has a selected a support.

id.name: ID
id.desc: ID of the screen to test.

on-maximized.description: Triggers when the window is maximized.

is-maximized.description: True if the window is maximized.

on-unmaximized.description: Triggers when the window is unmaximized.

on-minimized.description: Triggers when the window is minimized.

is-minimized.description: True if the window is minimized.

on-restored.description: Triggers when the window is restored.

on-move.description: Triggers when the window is moved.

is-visible.description: True if the window is visible.

on-window-message.description: Triggers when arrive a mesage from a window.

is-window-frame-visible.description: True if the window frame is visible.

is-taskbar-visible.description: True if the window is visible on the taskbar.

is-kiosk.description: True if window in kiosk mode.

is-always-on-top.description: True if window is in always on top mode.

is-visible-on-all-workspaces.description: True if window is visible on all workspaces.

is-protected.description: True if window is in protected mode.

on-close-prevent.description: Trigger when window prevented the close.

on-close-critical.description: Trigger when window prevented the close and must close the window e.g. shutdown.

is-instance-prevent.description: True if prevent other instance opening.

on-instance-prevent.description: Trigger when user tried to open an instance and that prevented.

argv-at.description: Get the argument value at zero based index.

exec-tag-at.description: Get the running command tag at zero based index.

at.name: At
at.desc: Index of command tag to get.

command-tag.description: In command trigger get the tag name.

command-messsage.description: In command trigger get the message e.g. out, error, exit message.

tray-tag-at.description: Get the tray tag at zero-based index.

menu-item-count.description: Get the menu item count at path.

path.name: Path
path.desc: Path of the menu.

menu-item-at.description: Get the menu item count at path in zero based index.

path.name: Path
path.desc: Path of the menu.

path.name: Path
path.desc: Path of the menu.

path.name: Path
path.desc: Path of the menu.

path.name: Path
path.desc: Path of the menu.

path.name: Path
path.desc: Path of the menu.

clicked-menu-item-path.description: The width of the UI window in the operating system.

clicked-menu-item-id.description: The width of the UI window in the operating system.

screen-id.description: In triggger get the screen ID

screen-id-at.description: Get screen ID at zero-based index.

at.name: At
at.desc: Index of instance ID to get.

screen-rotation.description: Get the rotation of the screen.

id.name: ID
id.desc: ID of the screen to get.

screen-scale-factor.description: Get the scaling factor of the screen.

id.name: ID
id.desc: ID of the screen to get.

screen-color-space.description: Get the color space of the screen.

id.name: ID
id.desc: ID of the screen to get.

screen-color-depth.description: Get the color depth of the screen.

id.name: ID
id.desc: ID of the screen to get.

screen-frequency.description: Get the refresh fequenc rate of the screen.

id.name: ID
id.desc: ID of the screen to get.

screen-physical-x.description: Get the physical starting X position of the screen. Note: this can be negative value.

id.name: ID
id.desc: ID of the screen to get.

screen-physical-y.description: Get the physical starting Y position of the screen. Note: this can be negative value.

id.name: ID
id.desc: ID of the screen to get.

screen-physical-width.description: Get the physical width of the screen.

id.name: ID
id.desc: ID of the screen to get.

screen-physical-height.description: Get the physical height of the screen.

id.name: ID
id.desc: ID of the screen to get.

screen-workarea-x.description: Get the usable area starting X position of the screen.

id.name: ID
id.desc: ID of the screen to get.

screen-workarea-y.description: Get the usable area starting Y position of the screen.

id.name: ID
id.desc: ID of the screen to get.

screen-workarea-width.description: Get the usable area widht of the screen.

id.name: ID
id.desc: ID of the screen to get.

screen-workarea-height.description: Get the usable area height of the screen.

id.name: ID
id.desc: ID of the screen to get.

window-width.description: The width of the UI window in the operating system.

window-height.description: The height of the UI window in the operating system.

window-x.description: The X position of the window in the screen.

window-y.description: The Y position of the window in the screen.

window-count.description: The count of the other window.

window-id-at.description: Get the oher window ID at zero based index.

at.name: At
at.desc: Index of window ID to get.

window-message-id.description: In trigger get the relevant window ID.

window-message-tag.description: In trigger get the relevant message tag.

window-message.description: In trigger get the relevant message.

frame-reload-message.description: The optional message if 'Set frame' action reload it.
